column1: Data Processing Pipeline for Whisper Hindi ASR FineTuning

The data processing began with downloading 103 audiotranscription pairs from Google Cloud Storage to a local cache directory using the gcloud CLI. Each audio file was loaded using HuggingFace's `Audio` loader which automatically resampled to 16 kHz
column2: while transcription JSONs were parsed to extract Hindi text. The preprocessing pipeline then applied Unicode normalization (NFC) to handle Devanagari script variations
column3: followed by Whisper's feature extractor to convert raw audio waveforms into 80channel logMel spectrograms. Text transcriptions were normalized (lowercased
column4: whitespace cleaned) and tokenized into token IDs using Whisper's Hindi tokenizer. To combat overfitting on the small dataset
column5: aggressive data augmentation was applied to 70% of samples including speed perturbation (0.851.15x)

column1: The processed dataset was filtered to remove samples with empty transcriptions or durations <1 second
column2: then split 85/15 into training and validation sets. During training
column3: a custom data collator dynamically padded audio features and text labels to uniform lengths within each batch
column4: masked padding tokens with 100 for loss computation
column5: and handled BOS token alignment. All features were stored as PyTorch tensors with `input_features` (audio spectrograms) and `labels` (tokenized text) ready for the Seq2SeqTrainer.
